intro: Smithia thouinia, commonly known as the mountain saxifrage, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Smithia thouinia is a hardy perennial that is well adapted to cold climates and is often used in rock gardens.
